info.name: Oracle Knowledge Management Redwood - Articles
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Knowledge Management (Redwood UX) â€” Articles module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Articles

query.description:
This parameter filters the fields returned in the response; look at the response schema to see the possible values. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links).

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource and root fields: ?fields=Attribute1;Child:Attribute1,Attribute2
Prevents links from being returned in the response, defaults to false.

request.description: This method rates the latest valid version of the Content object with the specified id.

formdata.description: Contains a collection of translations available of an article, if there are any.
Contains a collection of all versions of an article.
The unique identifier of an article in a locale.
Indicates whether the article needs to be automatically checked in after saving it.
Contains a collection of autosaves that exist for an article, if there are any.
The date and time when this article was last modified.
The date and time when the article will stop being available to display to end-users.
The date and time when the article requires a review by an author capable of performing the review.
The date and time when the article will be available to display to end-users..
The unique identifier of an article most usable for humans.
This field will return external associations of content such as a reference to an SR this article was created from.
REST API canonical and/or collection links for this Singular Resource
The unique identifier of the article. This ID is the same in all versions in all locales of the article and is recommended for programmatic use.
Returns information about the schema of an article.
The title of the document.
The version of the article.
The unique identifier of the specific version of an article in a specific locale. You cannot use this field in queries made using q query parameter.
The state of a version, possible values are SCHEDULED, LIVE, EXPIRED, DRAFT.
If this article version is a localization, this field may contain the version of the article the localization was created from.
The date and time when an author has checked out or locked the document for editing.
The date and time when this article was originally created.
The date and time when this article version was created.
The date and time when this article was last modified.
Indicates whether this article version is scheduled to go live in the future. The value is false for most article versions.
The date and time when this article version was published.
Indicates whether this article version is published. Default value is false for all versions other than the published version, if there is one.
If this article has a published version in the requested locale, this fields will contain the version number of the published article version.
Contents of the article.
Reasons for editing or creating an article version.
The list of categories associated with the article.
Indicates whether the purpose of the request was to get an editable version of an article. Default value is false.
The list of products associated with the article.
The user groups assigned to the content. Only the members of the assigned user group will have access to the content. Default value is Everyone.
The views assigned to the content. The user who has the view assigned to the content or the content type in which the content is saved can only access the content.

query.description:
This parameter filters the fields returned in the response; look at the response schema to see the possible values. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links).

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource and root fields: ?fields=Attribute1;Child:Attribute1,Attribute2
his parameter filters the returned items based on locale.  If used, this parameter will take precedence over Accept-Language.
This parameter restricts the number of items returned per page. If the limit exceeds the available items then all are returned.  The maximum value is 1000.

Used for pagination, this parameter indicates the starting point in the collection, for example. if you are returning 10 per page, have 100 items, and want to return the second page you would use limit=10&offset=10. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
Prevents links from being returned in the response, defaults to false.

This parameter orders items returned based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".
Used to filter the items in your response.  The available attribute/parameter combinations and usage instructions can be found in Reference > Supported Query Parameters.

Causes the response to include an "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise this count is not included.  The default value is "false".  It is recommended to only use this as part of the request for your first page of results.

This parameter filters the fields returned in the response; look at the response schema to see the possible values. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links).

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource and root fields: ?fields=Attribute1;Child:Attribute1,Attribute2
his parameter filters the returned items based on locale.  If used, this parameter will take precedence over Accept-Language.
This parameter restricts the number of items returned per page. If the limit exceeds the available items then all are returned.  The maximum value is 1000.

Used for pagination, this parameter indicates the starting point in the collection, for example. if you are returning 10 per page, have 100 items, and want to return the second page you would use limit=10&offset=10. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
Prevents links from being returned in the response, defaults to false.

This parameter orders items returned based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".
Used to filter the items in your response.  The available attribute/parameter combinations and usage instructions can be found in Reference > Supported Query Parameters.

Causes the response to include an "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise this count is not included.  The default value is "false".  It is recommended to only use this as part of the request for your first page of results.

item.description: The Articles resource lets you create, update, view, delete, and manage knowledge articles. You can also perform additional operations such as publish, translate, and import knowledge articles as part of the knowledge management life cycle. An article object stores information about knowledge articles.
